sentences.en: Punic faith; the perfidious Judas; the fiercest and most treacherous of foes; treacherous intrigues.
sentences.cn: 背信弃义; 背信弃义的犹大; 最凶恶、最奸诈的敌人; 背信弃义的阴谋.

sentences.en: The company was betrayed by its perfidious allies.
sentences.cn: 这家公司遭背信弃义的盟友出卖了.

sentences.en: Their feet will trample on the dead bodies of their perfidious aggressors.
sentences.cn: 他们将从背信弃义的侵略者的尸体上踏过。

sentences.en: When Caesar realized that Brutus had betrayed him, he reproached his perfidious friend.
sentences.cn: 当恺撒认识到,布鲁特斯背叛他, 他责备他背信弃义的朋友.

sentences.en: Your perfidious gossip is malicious and dangerous.
sentences.cn: 你说的那些背信弃义的话是很刻毒险恶的.

trans.tran_en: someone who is perfidious is not loyal and cannot be trusted
